DataElement.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

DataElementConcept.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

ObjectClass.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

Concepts.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for caDSR Requests Q12018 Dictionary Updates for Review (supplement) 3.15.18 mc   Confirmed list and released VD after verification of the property in the GDC data dictionary. 8/24/20 MRC

ValueMeaning.definition: Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism.

Concepts.definition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: A class of RNA molecule containing protein-coding information in its nucleotide sequence that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

Concepts.definition: A class of RNA molecule containing protein-coding information in its nucleotide sequence that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

ValueMeaning.definition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA, that is 20-25 nucleotides in length, which is transcribed from DNA but is not translated into a protein. This nucleic acid may regulate the transcription or translation of other genes.

Concepts.definition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA, that is 20-25 nucleotides in length, which is transcribed from DNA but is not translated into a protein. This nucleic acid may regulate the transcription or translation of other genes.

ValueMeaning.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

ValueMeaning.definition: DNA found in blood plasma and other bodily fluids that is not associated with cells.

Concepts.definition: DNA found in blood plasma and other bodily fluids that is not associated with cells.

ValueMeaning.definition: A biological specimen comprised of the RNA isolated from the nuclei of cells.

Concepts.definition: A biological specimen comprised of the RNA isolated from the nuclei of cells.

ValueMeaning.definition: A biological sample comprised of all of the RNA collected from an experimental subject.

Concepts.definition: A biological sample comprised of all of the RNA collected from an experimental subject.

ValueMeaning.definition: A biospecimen created to contain an isolated or enriched RNA sample.

Concepts.definition: A biospecimen created to contain an isolated or enriched RNA sample.

ValueMeaning.definition: Neoplasm-derived DNA found in blood plasma and other bodily fluids that is not associated with cells.

Concepts.definition: Neoplasm-derived DNA found in blood plasma and other bodily fluids that is not associated with cells.

RepresentationTerm.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
